title: Islamic / Muslim Schools
description:
Islamic schools, also known as Muslim schools or Islamic academies, provide education rooted in Islamic faith and values while meeting state academic standards. These schools integrate Quranic studies, Arabic language instruction, and Islamic history alongside core subjects like math, science, and English.

Key characteristics of Islamic schools:

• Daily prayers (Salat) and Islamic studies as part of the curriculum
• Arabic language instruction for Quran reading
• Emphasis on Islamic values, ethics, and character development
• Halal food options and observance of Islamic holidays
• Gender considerations may vary by school
• Focus on building Muslim identity in an American context

Islamic schools in Florida range from small community-based programs to larger accredited academies. Many participate in Florida's school choice scholarship programs including FES-UA, FTC, and FES-EO.

When considering an Islamic school, ask about their accreditation status, academic curriculum, Islamic studies program, and how they accommodate students with different learning needs.
